Reviews.Content: Great Location, Friendly Staff The Fiesta Americana hotel has a great location. If you are coming on business the price is right for a very average hotel. Definitely nothing to rave about here, but nothing done wrong either. The hotel is very dated, the TV worked rarely and I could not adjust the air conditioning in my room properly. I was shocked by how thin the towels were and the bar of soap was nearly microscopic. I was however thrilled to find a full service Starbucks just off the lower lobby. It became my oasis in between meetings.PS I checked out the Embassy Suites Mexico City - Reforma Hotel, MX - Exterior of Hotel Paseo de la Reforma #69 Colonia Tabacalera, M, Mexico which is just across the street. FAR NICER hotel and nearly the same price. FYI
Reviews.Author: tedhart

Reviews.Content: Affordable business hotel I stayed at this hotel for 1 night and the room was really outdated and it had a bad odor. I was too tired to ask for another room. The restaurant seemed to be overpriced. I stayed at Sevilla Palace across the street the weekend before ( for 3 nights) and was totally blown away with deal that I got. It had good food, very modern rooms, and the roof-top sun deck and pool were very very cool. The view was amazing up there. Reforma is a safer part of the city but really that's all it's good for. Next time I'd stay in Condesa or Coyoacan.
Reviews.Author: bigisland_hangten

Reviews.Content: Great location hotel It is a well located hotel in Mexico City, near Angel de la indenpendencia, also fairly close to Zocalo, Turibus stops by in front of the hotel, service is great, since you enter the lobby everybody is willing to help, taxi service from the hotel is kind of expensive, but rather that ride into the green VW taxis in the street, room was neat, clean and with good view of Paseo de la Reforma (main avenue in Mexico City), hotel Restaurant was ok with a variaty of buffets each day, bed and pillow were nice and clean, overall was a good weekend spent in this hotel.
Reviews.Author: Pumoso

Reviews.Content: Avoid At All Cost When we decided to visit Mexico for a fortnight. We stoped at this hotel for x4 nights in Mexico City, and then came back to it for x1 night, after spending x8 nights in Tulum near Cancun, before flying back to London, UK. All in all 5 nights at this Hotel.The hotel was booked by Trailfinders in London (travel agents) who have never ever dissappointed us. I was travelling with my baby daughter and wife, and had requested family friendly accomodation for our stay in Mexico City, and in Tulum.Keep in mind this hotel claims to be a 4 star. Where to begin, although child friendly (and by that I mean they provide high chairs in the restaurant), the facilities and service on offer at this hotel was abismal, lacking in choice, and far below the quality expected from this hotel. Our advice if you have to go to this hotel is...Do not make any phone calls as they are 8 times more expensive than buying a phone card (which I eventually did) and using a public phone. Plus they charged me for calls which never connected.Equally do not use room service (its rubbish), do not use their internet facility they charged us 50peso for 30 minutes, the cyber cafe's outside charge 5 peso for 30 minutes (so basically x10 mark up).Check your bills, as they tend to make a tonne of mistakes. And I leave the best for last. All hotels however many or little stars they may have you expect one thing, and that is that it is clean. Well I can guarantee that this hotel has an infestation (or plague your choice of adjective, as we couldn't think of a stronger adjective) of bed bugs, my wife and I were covered by bites, about the same time we were complaining (the day of our departure), they were changing all (and I mean all) the covers on our floor, and the next. The bathroom, was filthy and in serious need of some repair.All in all, if I were to use European standards, this hotel would not get a single star. It fails on hygiene, cost transparency (I am being diplomatic here), quality, variety, and service.Our advice, avoid it like you would a biblical plague.
Reviews.Author: RJM1London

Reviews.Content: Used condom stuck to the bathroom floor I stayed in this hotel 4/6/2008 to 4/7/2008. On my second day at the hotel I noticed a used condom stuck to the floor in the corner of the bathroom. The bathroom must have been cleaned twice with it there. When I complained to the manager they offered to change my room but nothing else. I had to extend my stay by one day. The rate for the extra day was double the two other days. When I complained about this at check-out, I mentioned again the used condom. They offered me a free breakfast.
Reviews.Author: smfarrell

Reviews.Content: Location, Location the hotel have an excellent location over beautyful paseo de la reforma ave, close to fine resturants, bars ,very walkeable and safe area, ask for a taxi at the hotel concierge or take a turibus to see the real beauty of this city. the food in the hotel restaurant is ok but overpriced, the rooms are ok, but the corridors are depressing (old and badly restored)for the price this is a good choice, but I will choose the sheraton the next time.
Reviews.Author: Azzul

Reviews.Content: Great location in financial district/Centro Historico June 19, 2006I just came from Mexico City yesterday from a four day holiday with a friend. The hotel is centrally located on a major street near the financial district and the old Centro Historico District. It is a great jumping point to all parts of the city. Overall, I was happy with my stay, but I must point out the good as well as the bad to be equitable and fair. The staff is quite knowledgeable, helpful, polite and bilingual. The service upon arrival, during and leaving was great. The hotel room and facilities were clean and tasteful but are beginning to show their age, but, still not a problem. The Food service is o.k. but servers seemed robotic and not helpful. Our bar service was bad. We entered one bar and were ignored by the bartender. So we went to the bar next door that had good service. The mattresses are hard or firm. I personally had a difficult time sleeping. If you like firm then it's o.k. If you travel for business this is a good place to be. The property does not have a pool. If you swim or have children this may be a factor to consider. I felt safe all the time I was there and would recommend this property taking into consideration price and what I just mentioned.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Very Good Location We chose the Fiesta Americana Hotel based on Trip Advisor information and were not disappointed at all. The service is excellent and we found that the concierge service was outstanding. They booked two tickets for us for a Sunday evening performance of the Ballet Folklorico on the spur of the moment and were able to attend without a problem. Taxi service was provided to and from the Palacio Belle Artes and was very reasonable and safe. The food in the buffet restaurant downstairs is excellent and the service is outstanding. Each room has a safe, which is very desireable. We could walk to many sights from this great location although we chose to catch tour bus (right in front of the hotel for 100 pesos a day per person). This tour bus is great service that takes in all parts of Mexico City. The hotel is just a tiny bit dated, but the rooms are very clean and the maid service is excellent.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Don't Let the bed bugs bite Normally I would rate such a hotel as above average but after staying there for business in February I returned covered with bed bug bites (disgusting!!!). This was my first encounter with such a thing, and hopefully my last! My dermatologist informed me bed bugs are becoming problematic again- he has treated several patients this year alone (people who had traveled all over...Mexico, Chicago, LA, New York, Dallas). As someone who travels quite a bit, I have now become very careful about where I stay as well as my handling of hotel bedding...once bitten, twice shy as they say.Bed bugs do not discriminate, even the most luxurious hotels can have bed bugs.
Reviews.Author: goldrushbrides

Reviews.Content: Good hotel, friendly staff, good location I stayed here for several nights in late March. It is on Reforma, about equidistant from the historic center and the Zona Rosa area. There is no subway in the immediate vicinity but busses go up and down Reforma. There is a taxi stand on the premises but it is expensive. On the other hand, they are safe and the cars are comfortable.The hotel has changed hands a couple of times. It used to be the Crowne Plaza. I believe the Fiesta American chain is now working on some upgrades, which are needed. The common areas are better than average - lots of shiny marble, typical first class Mexico City decor. The dining rooms are nice and the business center very nice.The rooms themselves are slightly on the small side and quite standard. My only real complaint is the fact that the rooms are a bit worn. The furniture is on the old side and the bedspread was faded and frayed. They had just put in new lamps in my room, so I'm hoping other upgrades are on the way. The bathroom was also on the smallish side, also with older fixtures but very clean and completely serviceable. I ordered room service for breakfast a couple of times and it came quickly. The food is good, not great. For better meals you'll have to travel a bit because there are not a lot of restaurants in walking distance. There is a Wings and Sanborns nearby (both Mexican chain restaurants that have decent coffeeshop type food), as well as a few other hotels. One of the best nearby restaurants is at the Sheraton Centro Historico on Juarez - taking the hotel cab, it will be a $9.00 US cabride. The restaurant Cardenals, inside, is absolutely first rate - updated Mexican food in an elegant atmosphere. They also have a smaller Italian restaurant which I found very good. A big plus for me, as a single woman traveler, is that the staff is friendly and helpful and the hotel is very secure. The safes in the rooms are not large enough for a laptop and I inquired about this with the concierge. She told me not to worry so I didn't, and nothing was ever touched in my room (on the other hand, I'd simply prefer that the safe be able to accommodate my laptop).I got my room for $70 US with Hotwire, a bargain considering that at the reception desk, they advertise a $125 room rate. I'd probably stay here again, and definitely would if I knew they had freshened the room decor.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Very Good Can't go wrong here. Good location, very nice hotel, excellent and friendly service, three restaurants to choose from and decent bar. The only negative I experienced is the lack of English spoken by the staff, but hey it's Mexico so I shouldn't be unfair. Just keep this in mind should you stay at this wonderful hotel.
Reviews.Author: mitchmurr

Reviews.Content: Convenient location, average hotel I didn't feel there was anything special about this hotel. The location was great, and you can easily walk back and forth to the airport in a few minutes. However, for the money, it was just an average stay. There must be some special tax there, because our bill was far higher than we expected. At the restaurant, we were told that the buffet was only open for 10 more minutes and we shouldn't order it. (We must have looked like heavy eaters) They were still bringing new food to the buffet when we left, after ordering off the menu.If you don't want the stress of traffic on the day you depart, this is a good choice. Otherwise, I'd suggest looking elsewhere.
Reviews.Author: huskersrtops

Reviews.Content: Beautiful experience Stood at the Fiesta Americana Reforma on EL Paseo de la Reforma and had the best time in Mexico City. Such a historc city with wonderful shops and a great currency conversion...air quality is not as bad as advertised. Cheap food, cheap tour deals, friendly people, excellent transportation system (El Metro). Highly recommend!!!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: A good choice! In Mexico, it can be a good choice. The hotel is very nice. The rooms are clean and with beautiful furniture and decoration. The bathroom is confortable and, the most important, all the staff is very helpful. You can contract a lot of tourist packages in the hotel. They also offer cab service, something important in Mexico City. Ask the driver for the prices first and you can be in agreement with it. Near from the hotel, you can find some fast food restaurants.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Loved Everything About It Everything is good about thislocation. The people, the service, their restaurant has the very best of gourmet and regular Mexican Food Reforma is a very lively area, close to many attractions like la Zona Rosa I WILL DEFINITIVELY GO BACK TO FIESTA AMERICANA REFORMA, AGAIN  AGAIN!!!I LOVED MEXICO, DF!!!!!!!
